column1: 3C1A9151-45CA-47B3-888A-5F6B4853CC9A#appfire#2A0A05D8-930F-4E81-817B-DAE7D03B6DCD#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-31 12:23:56.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-31 12:23:56.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#4CD7C109-5FB8-4604-8C18-3356C1A2088D#appfire#2A0A05D8-930F-4E81-817B-DAE7D03B6DCD#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-31 12:23:56.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-31 12:23:56.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#83B2B518-C617-4CB7-A319-BDDD7DA0BA3E#appfire#2A0A05D8-930F-4E81-817B-DAE7D03B6DCD#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-31 12:23:56.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-31 12:23:56.0#appfire#1
